author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> > <Recmo>  Just to confirm: Yes we need a HTTPS proxy because the sequencer does not support TLS, and we do want to use HTTPS. Adding TLS support to the API server is generally not a good practice because it moves the TLS certificate private key in-process. Plus you usually want a proxy for other reasons like DDOS protection. (re @kzg_ceremony_bot: <parithosh> [reply]: You'd also use Nginx for SSL termination, so you'd need it to provide HTTPS connections to the sequencer. Additionally you can set a 301 redirect if someone tries to use HTTP, you can then redirect them to use HTTPS.)
